revised_title: The Role of Blood Fluids in Phagocytosis and Opsonic Power
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the role of blood fluids in phagocytosis, specifically the presence of opsonins in human blood. They discovered that the increased phagocytosis associated with immunization is due to the development of opsonins in the blood fluids, rather than a modification of white blood cells. This research helps in understanding the body's immune response to bacterial infections.
